title: Why are people so toxic?
body:
Hey guys, I just wanted to take a moment to rant about people. 

So I am currently Silver I, but I was placed in Bronze IV this season (first placement matches ever, don't judge me please). Anyways, it seems like every game I do, people are just complete assholes. When one thing goes wrong, everyone points fingers at one person. I've seen it a lot in 4 man premade queues when I'm playing Solo Queue. It's so annoying. If I do one thing wrong, my entire team flames and reports me, even if I don't say anything. And keep in mind, this has been happening to me since BRONZE FUCKING 4. To anyone who is reading this that is higher elo, is it the same in Gold+? Is it worth it for me to keep climbing if all I'm going to do is encounter these toxic, feeding, trolls? Please let me know, because I'm debating whether or not I want to waste time climbing when I'm just going to be flamed. And by the way, Riot's report system isn't doing shit for me. I have been called many really bad things, whether it be general pejoratives or racial slurs. And this happens all game. I don't mute people because I need to actually communicate with my team, but ignoring it isn't very easy when they're spamming shit in chat because they macroed it to their keyboard. Anyways, thanks for reading my wall of text.

Combination of the ridiculously low standards of what is considered "toxic" these days and basic human nature.

Repeatedly telling someone to kill themselves or what a horrible, worthless person with no friends, life or hope they are for building a zeal before DFS seems pretty toxic.
So does running down lane on purpose because someone asked you to ward and not expose yourself to ganks.
So does any unneeded passive-aggressive comment about how bad your teammates/the other team are.

If it has no constructive purpose, intent is to annoy or enrage: toxic, intolerable, punishable. Zero excuses.

Responding to toxicity with sarcasm or passive aggressive content (not about how bad they are, but telling them to "fuck off" or "fucking stop") should be understandable though because it's human nature, but no. Riot has a 0% tolerance policy. Also some things like asking for reports being harassment is silly, if Riot just straight up came out and massively reminded the community for a month that more than one report is not necessary that action would stop. Instead, it's a bannable offense because they expect players to know that more reports won't get their report seen faster. Some of their rules are high shooting and a lot of players get banned for minor mistakes. And you're right about it getting worse up OMG I've heard tales of people in Challenger throwing fits worse than a Bronze V player. Because they are good, and they think they're perfect because they're top 1%.
"Understandable" is not the same thing as "acceptable."

> "Understandable" is not the same thing as "acceptable."

Not always. If you beat someone in self defense your punishment will be a lot lower than if you just beat someone. If you're passive aggressive instead of toxic to a toxic player it should be self defense. However, Riot does not see context like people in the real world, yes there are things you can't do that are unacceptable (like bombing a building, even if you have a reason). Actually in context that's okay as well, if you're a deconstruction worker you can blow up a building set to be deconstructed, because of context. Riot doesn't look at context which is their main problem. Context is the difference between understanding and acceptable.

There isn't a context in which it is appropriate to verbally abuse someone. This is something we learned in grade school. Again, that knee-jerk response is understandable, but that doesn't make it acceptable.

One of the things to bear in mind is that these situations don't just affect you and the person who insulted you. There are a bunch of other people stuck in the game with you, and you have a responsibility to your fellow players not to take a bad situation they are stuck in and make it worse. When you respond with aggression (passive or otherwise) you are contributing to the situation, not resolving it.

A lot of the time you can find yourself playing a game and you're doing well, and your bot adc for instance is dying left and right. Not to ganks, just dying over and  over again and you think: "ah well, it's fine; going to do my best to try and win." So there you are carrying early to mid game keeping your team in the game best you can as say the jungler for example.

Late game comes and you make ONE mistake and suddenly that adc from before just starts laying into you out of everyone else. You think: "I could have said so many things to that guy about 20 times before, wtf is he serious?"

This process happens over and over and over. It can be easy to get fed up from time to time. I'm not justifying toxicity at all, some people are really infectious with it though. Best to play some tunes you enjoy and mute whomever tries to spray their toxic garbage all over your game.

 It can be really diffusing to them when you don't react to their negativity and you go on communicating with the rest of your team. If you mute them they can still hear you. If they've proven to be toxic I'm willing to doubt they are going to have anything helpful to say.

I come back from a league break starts playing the game, but then after a week or so I can't look through the toxicity anymore and starts to hate playing. I've played since like season 1, but toxicity was not even nearly a big a problem for me as it is now. But people also seem to have become way more toxic, and it alrdy starts in champion select. It feeds me up and ruins the fun. I love to play league, but I feel like it's come to a point where its just not worth it anymore, because at the end of the day, we all just play to have fun and get a a break from daily stuff. However league is losing its appeal and its so annoying, because there is literally no reason to be so toxic, and you just ruin your own mood and everyone else mood, period...

Basically I just don't veer off point, the flame is always aimed at their repeated mistakes. Giving FB is not flameworthy, fighting your fed counterpart when you're 2 levels and an item behind after you've already given him 3 kills? Yes, you're gonna hear about it, and you're gonna deserve it too, whether or not you take it to heart is entirely up to you.

"Play better" doesn't really help anything lol. I can play as well as the division I'm in. I can't all of the sudden just develop Faker skills and trash everyone in gold. But yeah, I don't get flamed for "doing stupid things" if that's what you thought. I get flamed for making mistakes that barely affect the game. I realize everyone gets flamed, and I'm not the only one. But Riot needs to step it up because only 0.006% of league accounts are banned (I have a perma banned account, it shows this statistic on there). And at least 50% of people I've seen have said something worth being banned. You might call me a hypocrite because I've been banned before, and I'm not saying that I'm not toxic (well not anymore, but I was very toxic back then). But the amount of assholes in this game is kind of sad. I've received death threats for feeding first blood, and then silence when I carry the game later on. It's kind of funny actually, but some people take this very seriously. Like me (back when I made this post anyways).

People are so toxic because of the way the game works. Especially in lower elos, below plat I mean, people just don't understand basic macro and don't understand snowball system of league. As if for instance you have Jax who plays vs Fiora and fiora gets 1 or 2 kills. In lower elos instead of giving up farm and keeping the tower alive this Jax will just feed harder and harder and lead to a situation in which you play 4 vs 6 because Jax is 3 levels behind Fiora. This is the most apparent reason why people especially in lower elo flame so hard because other players might even unconsciously ruin their game singlehandedly. I know it's a team game but it's not a game like R6 Siege or Counter Strike where rounds last for 3 to 4 minutes and every round you more or less have equal chances of winning. In league the game usually snowballs out of control in addition to existence of super hard carry champions like Yasuo, Master Yi or Kassadin which are best picks for smurfs because are the easiest to 1 vs 9 them the game.

Another very triggering thing is the amount of AFKs in low elo. When I was in Gold 2 I remember that I had a match where I was playing Fiora vs Gnar and my jungle and mid went simultaneously afk in 4 min of the game. We lost in 21 mins and I lost -25 lp because of that and even though everybody reported them, nothing happened they didn't get banned or anything. They received the same penalty as the people that actually played the game 3 vs 5 and lost.

I get it that Riot can't just be permissive of not giving a penalty in lp when you lose a game but I personally believe that there is a huge amount of players who are just really good at the game and have their skill much higher than their elo suggests but because of the certain issues that Riot ranked system has they are hardstuck and as the time goes they become really frustrated and start flaming and may become oversensitive to other players feeding, not smiting well or just over that they play vs smurfs.

Not to mention the fact that even though you might go 0/10 and be completely useless in a match you may still be promoted to higher tier because of luck that your team is carrying you or just that you duo with a Grandmaster tier friend who boosts you while playing in duo.

Another thing are winning streaks that can get you in 30 matches from Silver to Diamond. This is a big bullshit because nobody is that good that they win every match even though they might just crush their opponents in lane or gank extremely well cause how you gank when your 3 lanes are 0/5. 

It's nearly impossible to make a perfect match making and ranked system but there are so many evident error in Riot's that it's no surprise that people that want to climb as the time goes on become tilted and start flaming, trolling, afking etc.

In my opinion competitive scene in LoL is really healthy and developing but the balance in the game and just the attitude of people makes the game in the longer run unenjoyable, stressful and tilting. Especially if your favourite champion doesn't get skin in 4 years and Yasuo, Zed and Lux get one every month or when you main Aurelion Sol that just gets destroyed by the rework comparing to newly reworked diana which is completely broken and in high elo has permabanned status.

It's because the game is frustrating as hell. Like a project that you build over a period of time, small mistakes accumulate to cause major consequences, and with it being a team game and all, people tend to get frustrated with the fact that they can't interfere, and basically what happens is that the inch of glass seperates you from the other player, basically to the point of objectification by champion. Either that or they're sociopaths, either way, tell them to calm down and ignore them, but if they're really bad just mute them.

People who play LOL are the same people you see every day - they are neither more nor less "toxic" than anybody else. The reasons they react in a toxic way while playing LOL are quite simple: 

(a) you get stuck with trolls / feeders on your team, who don't take the match as serious as you do, and they ruin your team's chances... 

(b) you get boosters / smurfs on the enemy team, who are simply that much better than you are, that they ruin your team's chances of winning

(c) there is NOTHING you can do about either. You are stuck, for at least 20 minutes, with (a) or (b) - you cannot leave (Riot bans your account), you cannot complain (Riot bans your account), you cannot punch them in the face (obviously... it's an online game) - all things you could EASILY do in a football / basketball / any other team sports court where you are physically present.

Simple. Has nothing to do with the people who play LOL, only with the system around it. Solutions are ALSO quite simple, however, they will make the game less addictive (i.e. "less money"), so they are not implemented.

**This is my opinion and not fact please do not hate on me.**
People become toxic when something in their life is going downhill. For an example will be losing around 2 - 3 games in a row. The player loses hope thinking that they will win the next game but something goes wrong like the JG ganking under the tower and dying. This cause the layer to be a little mad and see something about it, which in turn causes the JG to talk back and so on. This does not always happen but its what I believe causes a lot of the verbal abuse in the game.

Probably because EVERYONE has to deal with that, not just you, and the more you deal with it the less you're able to tolerate. When you're doing your best trying to climb, overcoming the nonsense of low elo, then someone makes an obvious error, a novice mistake, it reeeeally irks you when you've done everything you could to secure a win. 

A similar situation would be that people put so much practice and effort into learning how to play with the greatest skill level, only to be held back by those who didn't put in as much effort as them. 

Basically, it's team game nonsense. The problem with team games is individual effort does not matter if everyone else doesn't apply the same amount, and that too frustrates people. Personally, I've yet to see someone be toxic for the sole sake of toxicity. It's always "I told you" or "I'm tired of this elo" or "You should've done this". Sad, but understandable.
